TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in ORG .
ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant lodged a request with ORG for a review of the lawfulness of the construction of a sewage system on his estate . On DATE the ORG discontinued the proceedings as it found that the departure from the construction permit had not been serious . The applicant appealed .
On DATE ORG quashed the decision as it found that the departure from the construction permit was serious enough to warrant an examination of whether the construction was lawful .

Concurrently , on DATE the applicant lodged a request for annulment of the construction permit given to the investor - the GPE ( Gmina PERSON ) , by the Director of ORG ( PERSON ) . On DATE the GPE ( PERSON w PERSON ) annulled the construction permit given to the investor .

On DATE ORG issued a decision by which it found the departure from the construction permit to be serious , but also found that the applicant had given his consent to this . It obliged the investor to bring the works into conformity with the law . The applicant appealed , challenging the finding that he had consented to a departure from the construction permit .
On DATE ORG upheld the decision . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG .
On DATE ORG gave a judgment by which it quashed the decisions of DATE and CARDINAL DATE . It found the construction unlawful as being in breach of the construction permit .
On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint about the inactivity of ORG . On DATE ORG issued a decision in which it upheld the complaint .

On DATE ORG gave a decision in which it found that the sewage system works had manifestly departed from the construction permit and ordered the investor to make the necessary changes to the construction in order to bring it into conformity with the law . The applicant appealed , seeking the demolition of the construction works .
On DATE ORG quashed the decision and remitted the case to a lower authority .
On DATE ORG issued a decision ordering the investor to demolish the sewage system built on the applicant ’s estate . The applicant ’s opponent appealed .
On DATE ORG upheld the decision of DATE . On DATE the applicant ’s opponent appealed .
On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and the decision of DATE . On DATE the applicant appealed .
On DATE the cassation appeal was rejected as the applicant had failed to pay court fees within the prescribed time - limit .
For a description of domestic law , see : PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , judgment of DATE .

On DATE the Law of CARDINAL DATE on complaints about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time ( LOC o skardze na naruszenie prawa strony do rozpoznania sprawy w postępowaniu sądowym bez nieuzasadnionej zwłok i- “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) entered into force . It lays down various legal means designed to counteract and/or redress the undue length of judicial proceedings . A party to pending proceedings may ask for the acceleration of those proceedings and/or just satisfaction for their unreasonable length under LAW read in conjunction with section CARDINAL ) of LAW .

On DATE ORG ( Sąd Najwyższy ) adopted a resolution ( no . III SPP CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) in which it ruled that while the DATE Law produced legal effects as from the date of its entry into force ( DATE ) , its provisions applied retroactively to all proceedings in which delays had occurred before that date , but only when they had not yet been remedied .
